HACK_ArgumentsString HACK_ArgumentsStringLuthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommand Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommandHACK_ArgumentsString
string? Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommand.HACK_ArgumentsString[get], [set]
This property is being used tentatively during the development of an integrated terminal..
This allows for the terminal to be usable without lexing the arguments individually, but instead as just a raw string that is passed along.
(2024-04-07)
Definition at line 25 of file FormattedCommand.cs.
Tag TagLuthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommand Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommandTag
string Luthetus.Ide.RazorLib.CommandLines.Models.FormattedCommand.Tag = string.Empty[get], [set]
It is uncertain whether this tag property is a good idea. It allows one to easily re-use an Terminals.Models.IOutputParser..
By, the output parser being provided the Terminals.Models.TerminalCommand which caused the output.
But, determining the command that was ran would require parsing the HACK_ArgumentsString, because even though TargetFileName would be for example "git", one still doesn't know if it was "git add" or "git commit" etc...
Therefore this Tag can be used to identify more specifically what command was ran, allowing the Terminals.Models.IOutputParser to parse accordingly.
(2024-05-20)
